intro: Hieracium incisum subsp. pseudotrachselianum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers and finely divided, serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies. It is a herbaceous species that produces small, wind-dispersed seeds, contributing to its ability to spread across various habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
